TopicTitle: Yet another strike for the typical CoD player

Articles.Content:
I was just going around earlier when I found this: http://kotaku.com/death-threats-follow-small-call-of-duty-tweak-888324886

Needless to say I facepalmed really hard. I don't play CoD, but can someone who does explain me what the fuss is about? Like how come everyone just goes nuts for things like that? Is that the whole minority or a major part of the players that craze up this way? I'm confused honestly.

(Note the typical in the title, I'm not accusing every CoD player to be like this, but it seems like a majority of them are. So if you are a CoD player, you probably know how you are, don't feel targeted if this doesn't apply to you.)

You see here young forums people, this is what we will never (hopefully) see on these forums. We are nice space people!

And what these people are yelling about, is "Quickscoping", the description is in the name. Esentially you tap the aim in button then let go, and kill someone proceeding with 7 year olds yelling about how 1337 360 n0s0p3 cr055 m4p (Is how they think thats spelled)

and that's why i don't play CoD. really hate the community of these types of games.

I enjoyed BF3 for a while but then it started turning the same way as this

I also do not play COD. I hate it. It is so unrealistic.

Not trying to argue for CoD, because I really don't like it neither (although to me the reason lays in the lack of a potent story and the total repetitiveness of the game mechanics), you have to admit the KSP is not the most realistic thing either. Superdense planets, underweight star, wobbly rockets, etc. It's all for gameplay, and I believe that magical healing in CoD is for gameplay reasons too. But I still get your idea.

I like my warfare as realistic as i can get it.

yep i lost interest in Halo after 2. the first two were awesome. Man i remember getting my Xbox and Halo.... can you believe it was so flippin long ago.... holy crap. But after 2 i lost all interest. turned into another regurgitated game over and over.

and don't get me wrong, i played the others and tried to like them... just couldn't. I like being able to aim down the sights and Halo never evolved.

What do you expect? CoD's marketing is targeted entirely towards this little slew of children. Think about what a twelve year old would say about their commercials. That's why I don't even consider the Call of Duty series to be games, Howard Stern said it best "It's a bunch of little white punks running around and calling each other the 'N' word" Quite frankly, I've given up on multiplayer first person shooters, Red Faction and Just Cause 2 each quench my thirst for chaos and mayhem, unlike virtually every FPS I've played. If I want multiplayer, I have Red Faction, Saint's Row, and Army of two. And people, please, don't make fun of CoD, you're just beating a dead horse... a cold, rotting, decaying horse body full of 12 year old maggots... (Quite frankly, telling me that CoD is a game is an insult to my ingenuity, or proof of your lack thereof)
